title: @Meddler : Questions about the New Guinsoo
body:
I have 2 questions about the new Guinsoo :

1) The tooltip says that MELEE attacks grant 1 stack. Does it mean that RANGED attacks grant 0 stack ? I'm confused about the sentence.

2) About the passive "Guinsoo Rage" : does it work like the Phantom Hit of the live Sated Devourer ? I want to know if it means that Vayne's W will proc every 2 hit (same for Jax, Aatrox and so on). I'm also confused about this one. I know that Xin Zhao's W critical strike is an "on-attack" effect but according to many wikia, Vayne's W, Jax's R and Aatrox's W are "on-hit" effects.

replies.body:
Ok, I got a friend who has a PBE account and he tested quickly everything regarding Guinsoo in a custom game :

1) Ranged attacks and melee attacks both grant 1 stack.

2) "Guinsoo Rage" passive works EXACTLY like the live Sated Devourer. It means that {{champion:24}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:266}}  will proc every 2 AA instead of every 3 AA.

3) I'm sorry Riot, but are you OUT OF YOUR MIND ? It is also going to push {{champion:10}} and {{champion:203}} back to their "BAN IF YOU DON'T WANT TO LOSE" status, back when Sated Devourer was working for every ranged AA.
This is hilarious if true.

Oops, that should just read attacks at this point, it's one stack for both ranged and melee.

The passive works just like the current Devourer double hit one. We believe it should be much more balanceable on a more expensive item that's gated behind a build up.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7zirqlMq,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-04-19T21:58:07.513+0000)
> 
> The passive works just like the current Devourer double hit one.

As in every 2nd attack for melee and every 4th attack for ranged? Or will it be every 2nd attack for both?

Also, I saw the description of Guinsoo's only mentioning:
+35 Attack Damage
+50 Ability Power
Passive: Basic attacks deal at additional 15 magic damage on hit.
...and then the Guinsoo's stuff.

Does this mean that Guinsoo's (unstacked) actually loses the passive attack speed from the Recurve Bow? Or is this just a description error?

There are no differences between melee and ranged on the new Rageblade.

Unstacked Rageblade does indeed have less AS than its components.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7zirqlMq,comment-id=000100010001,timestamp=2016-04-20T19:01:47.203+0000)
>
> There are no differences between melee and ranged on the new Rageblade.
> 
> Unstacked Rageblade does indeed have less AS than its components.

That seems really wonky.

Why not give it 26% attack speed and lower the amount each stack gives?

Read again.

8% AS per stack

I don't think I'm the one who has to read again; I specifically said "Guinsoo's (unstacked)".

This makes a big difference because you will lose 25% attack speed when "upgrading" from 3 components into the final product, and will not gain it back until you attack 3+ times, and then lose it again once you've stopped attacking for 5 seconds.

I do not believe any (current) item in LoL has lower **base** stats than the individual components that create it.

Aren't you afraid that this item will be too powerful in lane ?

Like an Irelia rushing Guinsoo => never leave your lane, get stacks on minions then crush all your ennemies during your endless splitpushing ?
It's possible, at 3600 gold though it's got to compete with a range of other powerful items.

Because of the build up in the stacks it can be played around and has a bit of counter play old devourers didn't have.   With the reduction in how fast it stacks it should be a lot easier to balance....at least IMO.
Why the desire to keep the double hit passive? It seemed to make nothing but trouble the last 6 months. Do we really want Trist/Kog to have double hit ?
I don't think Trist having it will be that big but on Kog it'll be nice.

Consider how Kayle has been over-performing top lane for the past few patches, won't this just make her more over the top?

Hey, i already asked, but i don't know if it was seen
Is there any change in the phantom hit? I tried to build it on Azir on PBE but it seems the interaction with sand soldier is removed, is it normal?

I believe that Azir attacking with sand soldiers doesn't stack Guinsoo's to begin with so you might have to stack it up first then use sand soldiers. Though it also could be that Sand Soldiers don't count as an on hit effect.

No like the old rageblade, it still stack by soldier AA up to 6 on this new version (against 8 before), currently on live the phantom hit is applied, but not on the pbe with rageblade while still stack like the live version, that's weird
Can we just revert all the messy changes since preseason or delete this item entirely.
